choices.answer: A type of network hub
Any device connected to a network
A type of network switch

questions.question: What is meant by a network's topology?

choices.answer: The arrangement, or patterns, in which all nodes are connected
The model of network such as client-server or peer-to-peer
The transmission medium used, wired or wireless

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a star network?

choices.answer: Each node is directly connected to every other node
Each node is directly connected to at least two other nodes
All nodes indirectly connect to each other through one or more switches

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a mesh network?

choices.answer: All nodes indirectly connect to each other through one or more switches
Each node is directly connected to at least two other nodes
Each node is directly connected to every other node.
Disguising a message so that it cannot be understood by anyone except recie
Abbreviating data for simpler transmission and storage
Password protecting a file
A set of rules governing communication across a network
A component of data
A unique serial number assigned to a Network Interface Card (NIC)

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a bus topology?

choices.answer: Devices connected using one cable and terminators are placed at the ends
A set of devices connected using cables that form a straight line
Devices connected using multiple wires to share resources

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a ring topology?

choices.answer: Each device is connected to the one directly opposite for communication
Every device has exactly two neighbors for communication purposes
Wires are connected in a loop for communication
